comments: Smart, nice guy with a lot of experience. He really tries to engage students and provoke discussion. Downside is that a lot of the assignments are time consuming and he keeps the class until the last minute consistently.

Somewhat difficult class. One fairly easy homework each week that are an easy A as long as you follow the instructions carefully. I never took notes in class b/c all of the information we needed for the Midterm and Final was on the Slides he posted online. Our Final was a take-home that had questions/answers word-for-word from the study guide.

Took online with Camp, had him in 304 so knew what to expect. Late grading, very lax turn in schedule and easy A. Just do the work and use the book for the homework and you will be fine. Mid and final were open book online.

The class was easy, people would show up whenever. BUT! Dr Camp constantly was late on grading. Was inconsistent with how he graded and the final grade was off for alot of people. Take if you have no other option honestly.

Very nice professor. class is a bit boring but very informative. midterm exam was 100% study guide so getting an A was easy. He genuines means it when he said hes not trying to trick but actually wants you to learn the material. show up to class he gives random ex credit its awesome
Avoid. Not a bad instructor, but grades homework, exams, papers very late.
Hard homeworks and easy tests. Do not buy the textbook as it is useless. You only need his notes.
Avoid. The amount of homework assigned for this 3 credit undergrad class is ridiculous. Prof rarely responds to emails.

he\'s one of the smartest professor i\'ve ever met. okay his lectures are long and SOMETIMES you wanna fall asleep but his classes are interesting. you will learn a lot. TAKE HOME exams. no textbook use for this class. students actually applaud him on the last day of class. take him

Idk why so many people are saying this class is hard. Sure he was a tough grader on the homeworks but we could redo them every time. His exams would be impossible, but he allows a cheat sheet and gives previous tests on bb that are exactly the same; do the math. His class is very interesting and he loves the computer nerds! Recommend for an easy A.
probably the worst professor at GMU by far. DO NOT TAKE THIS GUY!!! HE HAS NO CLUE WHAT ENGINEERING IS AND HE CONFUSES HIMSELF EVERY 5 MINS
DON\'T MAKE ANY NOISES!
Avoid if possible! Class is already boring and then you have a teacher who is monotone and is not interesting!
AVOID! One of the worst professors I\'ve had at GMU. Mediocre knowledge of material. Doesn\'t like to help when approached. Sometimes refuses to help. Again, AVOID!
Lectures are boring and you have to attend class because he takes attendance. Very helpful outside of class though.

A bit scatterbrained... but with enough questions he\'ll get you the right answer; just make sure you\'re polite. He did occasionally contradict the book; but honestly that was the most poorly written textbook I have *ever* seen. Class was fun; if you can keep it light, he can take a joke and if you can write well, essay Q\'s are a (lengthy) breeze

Nice professor unless you ask him a question. He confuses himself when he tries to explain things, teaches from wikipedia and doesn\'t use the book at all. He spent 20 minutes on his cell phone in the middle of a lecture talking to his mom. Homework assignments go way beyond the material covered, tests are BS. I didn\'t learn anything in his course.

Never knows what he wants from you! He\'ll give you the most unfair grades, even when you answer the questions right. Do NOT take this guy unless you\'re an electrical engineer. He makes it impossible for newbies to learn the material.

This course is nothing but essays(and he grades them subjectively!). If you\'re a big fan of true/false and multiple choice exams, skip this guy. He wants to pick apart your two page reports and exam essays because you "didn\'t explain the concept clear enough" when the truth is he\'s very unclear about what he wants to receive. An absolute NIGHTMARE.

He gives you an 80 for a complete assignment but expects "exceptional" work for an A, which is at HIS discretion. Exams are essays, and the questions are so ambiguous that even if you answer right, if you don\'t answer HIS way you\'re wrong. He makes plenty of mistakes when he explains things, and his lectures CONTRADICTS the textbook!
